reviewText:
Wow. Okay, so here's a maze chase game between you and a zombified child except one of you can walk through the maze walls and the other can't. Two guesses as to who gets to wield that obscene power. This is actually unplayable. It's clear that from the start of the game, Zombie Kid spawns in the opposite corner of the maze and just zeroes in your position, striding through walls like the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Juggernaut until she either traps you in a dead end and just stands there waiting for you to end the game or suddenly no-clips through a wall to do it herself.
Difficulty ranges from Easy to Brutal but doesn't seem to have any impact on the game. Admittedly, I didn't try Brutal although I predict that doing so would give her a skateboard or the power of flight.
Check out the video below for a glimpse at this utter catastrophe.
https://youtu.be/-DVSlxsaEuc

reviewText:
The game appears to be very unfinished. Simple elements are absent. There's no sound effects for the rain or footsteps; performance is low in many places, motion blur is too high... hell, the pause menu indicates a 'Game Over' screen.

Worst of all, there is no surprise or suspense with the jumpscare (if you can even call it that). The control is taken away from the player, and the pacing of the game is slowed down, right before a very low-poly model of a zombie child 'attacks' you. There's no fun, and no variety in the environments, or in the scares.

There's certain parts that could have potential, but this is very beta-esque. And that price tag??? For this? Unreasonable. I filed for a refund after about a half hour of attempted gameplay (I will have a rather humorous LP video of it up, soon.)

Remember the movie 'The Room'? It was so bad that it was good? This kind of feels like that, only it's a game. It's kinda fun to laugh at it, actually, and that's what I enjoyed in my LP video. But, that's short-lived. Some super-big changes will need to be taken (haha, get it?) before I reconsider purchasing this game.

P.S. Thank you, Valve, for refunds.

reviewText:
I could talk about how bad the game looks and runs. I could talk about how laughable the horror is in this game, hell I could talk about how this game is more comedy material then a horror game all thanks to the little girl in the game but you know what, I wont.

The developer's behind this game admitted this game isn't perfect, it has problems and the release price was to high for what it was, but they at the least admitted this was their first PC game compared to the mobile games they developed. As bad as this game may seem I'll admit that they made a game that at the least works, something I have never come close to in my life even with RPG maker for god's sake? All game developers start off with crap but at the same time they learn from their mistakes and work on something better down the road, correcting what was wrong with their past games while learning to do far more in the future.

Ya I'm still giving this game a negative review because it's not a good game, but if the developer admits to whats wrong with the game and take in the negative reviews for future use then good for them, your already taking it better then some people in the gam

reviewText: Another bad indie game built on the Unreal engine 4... (Daylight, Time Ramesside)\n\nOn the easiest difficulty you can complete this so called first person indie horror game" in less than 10 minutes. If you crank up the difficulty the game just add a chasing ghost. There is only two levels in the game : the maze and the house. The maze is a total mess as it is so confusing to navigate through. The house
date: on the other hand is pretty much straightfoward. So basically what you do in the game is : 1) find your way in the maze
recommended: 2) find a giant skull that teleports you in a house

reviewText: I like supporting indie games, which is how I got this one. Having said that I can't recomend this in any way. There is no rhyme or reason to it, it is a maze that changes with something in it trying to kill you, and there is no way to defend yourself against said bad guy. I was able to escape only once, and it was more surprising than triumphant or enjoyable. The storyline is not well explained and not very believable. However, it is not real glitchy so that is one plus to the game developers. Not recommended I give it 2/10.

reviewText:
Loaded up the game.
Walked around the maze.
Lucy picked up my flares.
Got lost for 15 minuets.
Found the key.
Wandered around for another 15 minuets.
Looked away for a second and accidently turned up the volume on my headset.
Lucy found me and I ♥♥♥♥ my pant.
10/10 would play again. But with more pants.
